source_name: Availability of Comparable Poverty headcount ratio at $1.90 a day (5 year moving average)
spi_indicator_description: Comparability data from World Bank's Povcalnet
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Comparable data lasting at least two years within past 5 years.  0 Points. No comparable data within past 5 years

source_name: Availability of Mortality rate, under-5 (per 1,000 live births) data meeting quality standards according to UN IGME  (5 year moving average)
spi_indicator_description: Child Mortality Metadata from UN IGME
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. At least three indicators that met UN IGME standards within past 5 years. 0.67 Points. Two indicators that met UN IGME standards within past 5 years. 0.33 Points. One indicators that met UN IGME standards within past 5 years 0 Points. None within past 5 years

source_name: Quality of Debt service data according to World Bank
spi_indicator_description: Debt Reporting Metadata from World Bank
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Points. Actual value. 0.67 Points. Preliminary value 0.33 Points. Estimated value. 0 Points. No value

source_name: SDDS/e-GDDS subscription
spi_indicator_description: IMF GDDS compliance indicator
spi_indicator_scoring: Point. Subscribing to IMF SDDS+ or SDDS standards 0.5 Points. Subscribing to IMF e-GDDS standards. 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: ODIN Open Data Openness score
spi_indicator_description: ODW Openness score
spi_indicator_scoring: Our source for this indicator is Open Data Watch.  Scores range from 0-100.  For more details, consult the ODIN technical documentation.

source_name: NSO Website
spi_indicator_description: New indicator of number of non-recurring products on NSO website (ad hoc/experimental rather than regular releases). The indicator is the number of products found.
spi_indicator_scoring: No established methodology.

source_name: NADA metadata
spi_indicator_description: NADA/NSO websites
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Yes, available. 0 Points. No

source_name: Population & Housing census (Availability score over 20 years)
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Population census done within last 10 years. 0.5 Points. Population census done within last 20 years. 0 Points. Otherwise

spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. census done within last 10 years. 0.5 Points. census done within last 20 years. 0 Points. Otherwise

spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. census done within last 10 years. 0.5 Points. census done within last 20 years. 0 Points. Otherwise

spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. 3 or more surveys done within past 10 years. 0.6 Points. 2 surveys done within past 10 years. 0.3 Points. 1 survey done within past 10 years. 0 Points. None within past 10 years

source_name: Agriculture survey (Availability score over 10 years)
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. 3 or more surveys done within past 10 years. 0.6 Points. 2 surveys done within past 10 years. 0.3 Points. 1 survey done within past 10 years. 0 Points. None within past 10 years

spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension

spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension

spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for sources dimension

source_name: Social Protection Admin (ASPIRE) (5 year moving average)
spi_indicator_description: Administrative data available on social protection programs from ASPIRE (World Bank) databases
spi_indicator_scoring: Scoring is 1 if administrative data is available to produce beneficiary counts or expenditures for any social protection and labor program, 0 otherwise. In order to smooth out gaps in reporting, we take a moving 5 year average of the score.

source_name: Education (UNESCO) (5 year moving average)
spi_indicator_description: Administrative of nationally representative learning assessment
spi_indicator_scoring: In order to score this indicator, we calculate the fraction of the indicators that were produced in a country in a year. In order to smooth out variation from year to year in reporting or conducting national assessments, we take a moving 5 year average.

source_name: CRVS (WDI)
spi_indicator_description: Civil Registration and Vital Statistics (CRVS) complete
spi_indicator_scoring: Birth registrations 90% complete and death registration 75% complete according to UNSD.

source_name: Labor Admin (ILO) (5 year moving average)
spi_indicator_description: Administrative data available for labor statistics from ILO databases
spi_indicator_scoring: To produce a score, we calculate the percentage of six admin sources that are available for a country in a given year. In order to smooth out gaps in reporting, we take a moving 5 year average of the score.

source_name: Geospatial data available at 1st Admin Level
spi_indicator_description: Indicator data availability at sub-national levels
spi_indicator_scoring: Our source for this indicator is Open Data Watch.  Indicator is whether data available at first administrative data level.  Scores range from 0-100.  For more details, consult the ODIN technical documentation.

source_name: NSO Website
spi_indicator_description: New indicator based on references to private/citizen generated data in metadata relating to content on NSO website
spi_indicator_scoring: NA

source_name: Legislation Indicator based on PARIS21 indicators on SDG 17.18.2
spi_indicator_description: Based on PARIS21 indicators on SDG 17.18.2 (national statistical legislation compliance with UN Fundamental Principles of Official Statistics), existence of National Statistical Council, national statistical strategy generation, national statistical plan. Also include some other legislative aspects that foster good use of statistics eg freedom of information, privacy/transparency, good governance (eg free and fair elections).
spi_indicator_scoring: Scores is 1 if the country has a national statistical legislation compliant with United Nations Fundamental Principles of Statistics. Scores of 0 or scores with missing values are treated the same (both given a score of zero).

source_name: System of national accounts in use
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: Scoring: 1 point for using SNA2008 or ESA 2010, 0.5 points for using SNA 1993 or ESA 1995. 0 points otherwise

source_name: National Accounts base year
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 point for chained price, 0.5 for reference period within past 10 years. 0 points otherwise.

source_name: Classification of national industry
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Latest version is adopted (ISIC Rev 4, NACE Rev 2 or a compatible classification). 0.5 Points. Previous version is used (ISIC Rev 3, NACE Rev 1 or a compatible classification). 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: CPI base year
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Annual chain linking. 0.5 Points. Base year in last 10 years. 0 points. Otherwise

source_name: Classification of household consumption
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Follow Classification of Individual Consumption by Purpose (COICOP). 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: Classification of status of employment
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Follow International Labour Organization, International Classification of Status in Employment (ICSE-93) or 2012 North American Industry Classification System (NAICS). 0 Points Otherwise.

source_name: Central government accounting status
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Consolidated central government accounting follows noncash recording basis. 0.5 Points. Consolidated central government accounting follows cash recording basis. 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: Compilation of government finance statistics
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Follow the latest Government Finance Statistical Manual (2014)/ ESA2010. 0.5 Points. Previous version is used (GFSM 2001). 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: Compilation of monetary and financial statistics
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. Follow the latest Monetary and Finance Statistics Manual (2000) or Monetary and Finance Statistics: Compilation Guide (2008/2016). 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: Business process
spi_indicator_description: SPI scores for standards and methods dimension
spi_indicator_scoring: 1 Point. GSBPM is in use. 0 Points. Otherwise

source_name: PARIS21 indicator on data literacy
spi_indicator_description: PARIS21 indicators such as statistical society presence and data literacy. PARIS21 may also have material on Internal skills capacity and numbers of statistically qualified people in the country.
spi_indicator_scoring: The source is Paris 21.  Score ranges from 0 to 100.  Following the PARIS21 scoring, the score is the weighted sum of each of the four components’ scores, whose relative weight is reported in brackets: i) Basic Consideration (25%); ii) Diagnosis and quantification (24%); iii) Statistical Analysis (22%); iv) Disaggregation (29%).

source_name: Partnerships
spi_indicator_description: New indicator based on textual analysis of NSS reports/websites for references to partner organisations.
spi_indicator_scoring: NA

source_name: Finance Indicator based on PARIS21 indicators on SDG 17.18.3 & SDG 17.19.1
spi_indicator_description: Indicator based on PARIS21 SDG indicators (SDG 17.18.3 (national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation) and SDG 17.19.1 (value of resources made available to strengthen statistical capacity)). Could also incorporate indicator of NSO budget as a percentage of GDP.
spi_indicator_scoring: Scores is 1 if the country has a national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation. Scores of 0 or scores with missing values are treated the same (both given a score of zero).
